lines.content: Bug is a friendly task management chatbot that helps you keep track of your todo items, deadlines, and events through a simple conversational interface! :)
1. Download the latest bug.jar file from the releases
2. Double-click the jar file to launch Bug
3. Type commands in the text box and press Enter or click "Send"
4. Bug will respond and help you manage your tasks!
Add a simple task without a specific date.
Add a task with a due date.
Add a task with start and end times.
Mark a task as not done.
Remove a task from your list.
Postpone deadline or event tasks by a specified duration.
* Duration format: <number><unit> where unit is d (days), h (hours), or m (minutes)
*Note: Todo tasks cannot be snoozed as they don't have dates.*
* Task numbers start from 1 and are shown when you use the list command
* Bug automatically saves your tasks, so you won't lose them when you close the application
* If you make a mistake in a command, Bug will show you a helpful error message
* Commands are case-insensitive, so LIST, list, and List all work the same way
* Make sure you have Java 11 or later installed
* Try running from command line: java -jar bug.jar
* Check that Bug has permission to create files in the folder where you're running it
* Bug saves tasks to a data folder in the same location as the jar file
* Check the command format matches the examples above
* Make sure dates are in the correct format (yyyy-MM-dd)
* Task numbers should be positive integers

Bug is a friendly task management chatbot that helps you keep track of your todo items, deadlines, and events through a simple conversational interface! :)
1. Download the latest bug.jar file from the releases
2. Double-click the jar file to launch Bug
3. Type commands in the text box and press Enter or click "Send"
4. Bug will respond and help you manage your tasks!
Add a simple task without a specific date.
Add a task with a due date.
Add a task with start and end times.
Mark a task as not done.
Remove a task from your list.
Postpone deadline or event tasks by a specified duration.
* Duration format: <number><unit> where unit is d (days), h (hours), or m (minutes)
*Note: Todo tasks cannot be snoozed as they don't have dates.*
* Task numbers start from 1 and are shown when you use the list command
* Bug automatically saves your tasks, so you won't lose them when you close the application
* If you make a mistake in a command, Bug will show you a helpful error message
* Commands are case-insensitive, so LIST, list, and List all work the same way
* Make sure you have Java 11 or later installed
* Try running from command line: java -jar bug.jar
* Check that Bug has permission to create files in the folder where you're running it
* Bug saves tasks to a data folder in the same location as the jar file
* Check the command format matches the examples above
* Make sure dates are in the correct format (yyyy-MM-dd)
* Task numbers should be positive integers
* The Bug class is the entry point of the task management application.
* It interacts with the user, manages tasks, and stores them in a file.
* Constructor initializes the application by setting up the user interface (UI),
* loading tasks from storage, and preparing the task list.
* Runs the application, accepting user input and executing commands in a loop.
break; // Exit the loop if input is null
Command command = Parser.parse(input); // Parse the user input into a command
String response = command.execute(tasks, ui, storage); // Execute the command
if (command.isExit()) break; // Exit if the command signals to quit
System.out.println(ui.showError(e.getMessage())); // Show error message if command fails
* Returns the response to a given user input.
* This is used for testing purposes or when the application needs to respond programmatically.
* @param input the user input to process
* @return the response based on the input
return ui.showError(":(! please enter a command!");
Command cmd = Parser.parse(input); // Parse the input into a command
String response = cmd.execute(tasks, ui, storage); // Execute the command
Platform.exit(); // Exit the JavaFX application if the exit command is issued
return ui.showError(":(! something went wrong! Please try again.");
* The main method is the entry point for the application. It starts the task management system.
Bug bug = new Bug(); // Create an instance of the Bug class

* This class extends the built-in Exception class to provide custom error messages.
* Constructs a new BugException with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message to be passed to the exception
} // Pass the message to the parent Exception class
* Represents the 'Bye' command, which is used to exit the task management application.
* When executed, it displays a farewell message and indicates that the program should terminate.
* Executes the 'Bye' command by displaying a farewell message.
* This method is called when the user wants to exit the application.
* @param tasks the current list of tasks (not used in this command)
* @param ui the user interface responsible for displaying messages to the user
* @param storage the storage system (not used in this command)
* @return a farewell message to the user
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
return ui.showBye(); // Display the farewell message using the UI
* Returns true to indicate that this command causes the program to exit.
* This method is used to signal the end of the program's execution.
* @return true, indicating that the program should terminate
return true; // The 'Bye' command triggers the exit process
* Abstract class representing a command in the task management application.
* All specific commands (e.g., Add, Bye, List) will extend this class and define
* the logic for executing the command.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* Each subclass of Command will implement its own specific behavior for executing the command.
* @param tasks the current list of tasks that the command can operate on
* @param ui the user interface used to display output to the user
* @param storage the storage system used to load or save tasks
* @return a response string to be shown to the user after executing the command
* @throws BugException if an error occurs while executing the command
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BugException;
* Determines if the command should cause the program to exit.
* The default implementation returns false, but subclasses (e.g., ByeCommand)
* can override this method to indicate that the command leads to an exit.
* @return true if the command should cause the program to exit; false otherwise
return false; // Default behavior is that the command doesn't exit the application

* Executes the TodoCommand by creating a new Todo task and adding it to the task list.
* If the description is empty, a BugException is thrown.
* @param tasks the current list of tasks
* @param ui the user interface used to display the result
* @param storage the storage used to save the tasks
* @return a response message showing the created Todo task
* @throws BugException if the description is empty
